vision.notes: Characidae possess well-developed vision for detecting prey and navigating their environment. Some species, like Deuterodon heterostomus, may use visual mimicry for predation.

chemoreception.notes: Likely uses chemoreception to detect food and other chemical cues in the water.

mechanoreception.notes: Possess a lateral line system for detecting vibrations and pressure changes in the water, aiding in predator avoidance and prey detection.
